AdditionalFields.Value: Regulatory Science and Policy,Prevention / Early Detection / Interception

Description: The marketplace of tobacco products has diversified with addition of a wide range of non-combustible products, including electronic cigarettes and heat-not-burn devices.  These devices deliver emissions produced by processes not involving combustion and hence are proposed as harm-reduction alternatives to combustible cigarettes. However, the overall impact of these change in tobacco products on public health remains uncertain and controversial, particularly because of the consequences of their availability for initiation of using tobacco products.  This session provides an overview of evidence on risks of combustible and non-combustible products and the complex challenge of understanding the public health consequences of the changing tobacco marketplace.
SearchResultBody: APRV03. Combustible and Non-Combustible Tobacco Products
Title: Combustible and Non-Combustible Tobacco Products
